Credit Line: The Jefferson R. Burdick Collection, Gift of Jefferson R. Burdick
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The United States and Canada, 1800–1900 A.D.
Description: Trade cards from the "Fancy Dress Ball Costumes" series (N107), issued in a set of 50 cards in 1889 to promote Honest Long Cut Tobacco, manufactured by W. Duke Sons & Co. Each card depicts a famous actress of the day wearing an elaborate hat. Series N107 uses the same checklist of images as the smaller-format series, N73. In N107, however, each image is surrounded by a colored border, expanding the size of the overall card.
